ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: Its level related!!!!   There s no other thread, there s no other explanation.  Once you hit 29th lvl, Dragon will become available, once you hit 24th lvl,
ygData.messageBody:
Its level related!!!! There's no other thread, there's no other
explanation. Once you hit 29th lvl, Dragon will become available, once you
hit 24th lvl, Combine becomes available, so forth, so on.

Talarin Kal'Amon, High Elven Wizard


----- Original Message -----
From: Magis <Magis@...>
To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 6:39 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Languages


> From: Magis <Magis@...>
>
> Snicker wrote:
>
> > From: Snicker <snicker@...>
> >
> > At 03:04 AM 5/11/99 -0700, you wrote:
> > >From: "Frank Varbel" <fvarbel1@...>
> > >
> > >i think you can train in any language at your guild once you have been
> > >exposed to it. for example i bet you spent some time in blackburrow
before
> > >you went and checked. and now you can train in gnoll.
> >
> > Nope nope and more nope.
> >
> > When I reached 10th level Bard, having never left the continent of
Faydwer,
> > I suddenly discovered Gnoll as a language option. Unless I'm greatly
> > mistaken, there are no Gnolls on the entire continent. And if there
are,
> > well, I've missed them.
> >
> > It's not exposure - it's class/level related.
> >
> > Talies on Bristlebane
> > http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/bards/eqbard.htm
> >
>
> Ok .. Hmm I'm Thinking because of the Different scenarios there can be
only one common thread . Exposure YES,
> but no to the creature, but the language???? Or Different creatures Use a
Group of languages So there are ones In
> Odus That would activate Gnoll maybe kerrians ..??
>
